name: Frida
summary: Dynamic binary instrumentation framework for inspecting and modifying application behavior at runtime
details: Comprehensive guide for using Frida in penetration testing engagements.

steps.detail: Update package manager and install Frida
Use apt to install Frida on Kali

operational_tips: Always verify Frida is installed correctly before engagements
Use Frida within scope boundaries defined in rules of engagement
Document all Frida findings for reporting
Review Frida output for false positives

advanced_usage.title: Advanced Frida techniques
advanced_usage.scenario: Complex Frida scenarios in advanced assessments

installation.summary: Install Frida and Frida tools for dynamic instrumentation

steps.detail: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y python3-pip

installation.summary: Run Frida in Docker with Android emulator

steps.detail: # Download Android emulator with Frida pre-installed
frida-server must be running on target device/app

tips: Frida works with Android, iOS, Windows, macOS, and Linux
JavaScript API provides hooks for system functions, methods, memory access
Use frida-ps to enumerate running processes before attaching
TypeScript support available for better IDE integration
Combine with objection for advanced iOS/Android penetration testing

steps.title: Install Frida server
steps.command:
adb push frida-server-15.3.0-android-arm64 /data/local/tmp/
adb shell chmod +x /data/local/tmp/frida-server-15.3.0-android-arm64

steps.title: Start Frida server
steps.details: Start the server on the device

steps.title: Forward port
steps.details: Forward USB port for remote connection

steps.title: Create hook script
steps.details: Write JavaScript to hook target function

workflows.name: Android app reverse engineering with Frida

stages.label: Device setup
stages.command: adb devices; adb shell getprop ro.build.version.release

stages.label: Install Frida server
stages.command: adb push frida-server /data/local/tmp/; adb shell chmod +x /data/local/tmp/frida-server

advanced.title: Memory scanning and modification
advanced.scenario: Search and modify memory values in running app
advanced.command: frida-ps -U | grep -i app; frida -U -p PID -l memscan.js

name: APKTool
summary: Reverse engineering tool for decoding and rebuilding Android APK files
details: Comprehensive guide for using APKTool in penetration testing engagements.

steps.detail: Update package manager and install APKTool
Use apt to install APKTool on Kali

operational_tips: Always verify APKTool is installed correctly before engagements
Use APKTool within scope boundaries defined in rules of engagement
Document all APKTool findings for reporting
Review APKTool output for false positives

output_notes.meaning: Contains Android bytecode - intermediate representation between Java and DEX
Contains drawables, layouts, strings and other resources
Critical app configuration - permissions, activities, services

advanced_usage.title: Advanced APKTool techniques
advanced_usage.scenario: Complex APKTool scenarios in advanced assessments

steps.detail: docker run --rm -v $(pwd):/work -w /work openjdk:11 bash -c 'wget https://bitbucket.org/iBotPeaches/apktool/downloads/apktool_2.7.0.jar && java -jar apktool_2.7.0.jar'

notes: Creates folder with resources and code
Builds new APK from modified source

tips: APKTool is essential for Android APK reverse engineering
Always work on copies of target APKs
Smali code is Android bytecode - decompile with d2j or use JADX for Java
Rebuilt APKs need signing before installation

stages.label: APK extraction
stages.description: Get app from device or source

stages.label: Signing
stages.command: jarsigner -verbose -sigalg SHA1withRSA -digestalg SHA1 -keystore key.jks app-mod.apk alias

advanced.title: Hooking with Frida
advanced.scenario: Combine APKTool analysis with Frida runtime instrumentation
advanced.command: # Use APKTool findings to create targeted Frida hooks

name: JADX
summary: Advanced Java decompiler for analyzing Android applications and bytecode
details: Comprehensive guide for using JADX in penetration testing engagements.

steps.detail: Update package manager and install JADX
Use apt to install JADX on Kali

operational_tips: Always verify JADX is installed correctly before engagements
Use JADX within scope boundaries defined in rules of engagement
Document all JADX findings for reporting
Review JADX output for false positives

output_notes.meaning: Source code successfully recovered from bytecode
Some bytecode could not be decompiled - check original

advanced_usage.title: Advanced JADX techniques
advanced_usage.scenario: Complex JADX scenarios in advanced assessments

steps.detail: docker run --rm -v $(pwd):/work -w /work openjdk:11 bash -c 'wget https://github.com/skylot/jadx/releases/download/v1.4.7/jadx-1.4.7.zip && unzip jadx-1.4.7.zip'

notes: Creates output folder with Java source

tips: JADX produces better Java output than other decompilers for modern Android
GUI interface extremely helpful for interactive analysis
Handles obfuscation better than many competitors
Export to Gradle for use in IDE like Android Studio

steps.title: Decompile APK
steps.details: Convert bytecode to readable Java source

steps.details: Look for hardcoded credentials, API calls

advanced.title: Integration with IDE
advanced.scenario: Import decompiled project into Android Studio
advanced.command: jadx --export-gradle app.apk; # Import as gradle project
